CatDescriptText: Miss Donna Youngblood, student, and part-time employee, Magee Hospital, 769 Anaheim St., was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 12, 1959, pg. A13 with question: "Do you think that the President of the United States should intervene in the steel strike, or should he wait, and then invoke the 80-day 'cooling off' period as prescribed in the Taft-Hartley Act?" answer reads: "I think he should intervene. The longer he waits, the longer men will be out of work.  And, this unemployment situation isn't helping matters one bit."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Donna Youngblood wearing dark button down collared shirt with short cuffed sleeves, holding paper bag, standing on sidewalk next to decorative brick building
